addressleaf.section:
To my L. Treasuro
r
Fe
b
11. 90.

page.lettertext:
fol.70r
Belgia 1591 st
i
Ro
m
xi Fe
b
To my L. Trea
s
Belgia: 1591: Feb
r
May it please yo
r
good L. After I had written
and sent away my former, of
e 9 of this moneth,
this letter of
e
states
was brought unto me by
their
Greffier:
whiche is their answear to her
Ma
ties
letter of
e 21 of De
c
and to my Proposition
to
e same
upon it
. Because I have written of these
affaires, at sufficient length already, and likewi
[se]
of those maters, that were committed to
S
r
John
Norreis
, I have nothing by this bearer to adverti
[se]
further, but that we have intelligence from di-
vers quarters, that the
Empero
rs
Ambassado
rs
are at
Andwerp,
and minde to send hither for
a passeport to come to
a
Treatie w
t
e states. The
[re]
is also advertisment given, that
e Spaniard
[s]
are mutined in
e land of
Liege,
for want of
pay. Whiche will be some stoppe to
e Enemies
attemptes: especially if it prove, as we are also
informed, that in sundrie other places they
are bent to doe
e like.
And thus for this p
nt
I take my humble leave. From
e Hage
Fe
b
11 1590.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
